ee1cb8986c0c.description: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same about us, wonder about what is different & embrace one another anyway without condition.
ee1cb8986c0c.name: This Glorious Mess

header.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
header.title: This Glorious Mess

ee1cb8986c0c.shortDescription: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same…

collectionHeaderMetadata.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
collectionHeaderMetadata.title: This Glorious Mess

paragraphs.text:
If you were to ask me
when was the last time 
I was in love, I’d say — 
“Oh, just yesterday. 
the breeze from the trees
tucked me in last night
while I dreamed of new rules
and kicked about in my house-shoes.”
paragraphs.name: 589f
ee30
paragraphs.text: There’s always someone, a cause. The deep that carries into the deep. A mountain welcoming all molehills. There’s always someone… And, that someone may not know they’re your someone. You may not know you’re theirs. The two of you, shy-in-wait, unable to speak what has already been spoken, so you make up stories as to what you are supposed to be, but leave out all of the reasons why you cannot be.

paragraphs.name: a83c
paragraphs.text: Powerful powerful words! My heart just skipped a beat.

This is it right here. You know that feeling when you’ve finally seen a friend or family member after a decent span of time, and because of that distance and time, you can see how much that other person has grown and changed? That’s how I’ve been feeling reading your latest pieces Tre. Reading this particular piece felt like sitting across from you and listening to your story. It’s beautiful in its raw strength mixed with fragility. I love this. I felt this.

paragraphs.name: 2ea9
paragraphs.text: Hugs and best wishes, dear Tre. Restful sleep and happy awakenings.

paragraphs.name: 2aa9
paragraphs.text: Together, we pump my heart back to a beating state and we move on.
Tre L. Loadholt I agree with another commenter that your writing seems to have deepened and grown even more rich while you were gone. Beautious. And yes, I’ve got this week starting tomorrow night.
paragraphs.name: 99fc
185a
paragraphs.text: I am responsible. I keep up with my daily routine. I take my vitamins. I visit my physician every three to six months. She and her staff poke and prod. They make sure my levels are where they need to be for me to continue to live a vibrant life. I smile. I nod. I tell her I have gained 23 lbs. She looks at my digital chart, nods, smiles, takes in what I am saying. She asks me about the weight gain. I tell her about you.
I lie.
paragraphs.name: dd96

paragraphs.text: This made my heart work. No words. ❤

This is it right here. You know that feeling when you’ve finally seen a friend or family member after a decent span of time, and because of that distance and time, you can see how much that other person has grown and changed? paragraphs.text: Had the best birthday I’ve had in years. (Thanks for asking.) About two dozen friends/relatives showed up. We went to a wonderful Italian/Greek restaurant near my house. Delish … “How am I?” Getting better. (Click here for an update.)
